explosives.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

flammable_gases.rationale: Based on the description in ICSC (1999): the lower explosion limit is 10vol%. Not classified as "Flammable/Combustible Gas" by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods. A special provision sets forth that the substance is "combustible under limited conditions" (UN#1062 (those not exceeding chloropicrin 2%)). Bromomethane is "regarded as a special case depending on the regulatory purposes" according to the criteria for "flammable/combustible gas" in GHS.

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified into Division 2.3 (UN#1062 (those not exceeding chloropicrin 2%)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

gases_under_pressure.rationale: The boiling point is 4degC (ICSC (1999)), and the critical temperature is 194degC (Merck (13th, 2001)) - i.e., liquefied gas. Classified into Division 2.3 (UN#1062 (those not exceeding chloropicrin 2%)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

organic_peroxides.rationale: Classified as "gas" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gas substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 214mg/kg (SIDS (2003)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation of gas) value of 600ppm (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "gas" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its vapour is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "gas" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its dust/mist is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the report of rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979)): "One of six test animals exhibited only slight erythema after 24 hours of application. By 48 hours, the effects had resolved."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the report of rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979)): "Mild irritation of the conjunctiva was observed. All affected animals fully recovered by 24 hours."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests) although Ames tests were positive (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no increase in tumor incidence in a 2-year carcinogenicity study by dietary admixture (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)). The substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2001), Group 3 by IARC (1999) and Category D by EPA (1990).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of malformation (fused sternebrae, missing gallbladder or missing caudal lobe of lung) in pups at doses causing maternal toxicity in rabbit teratogenicity studies, described in SIDS (2003), IRIS (2005) and CERI Hazard Data 2000-28 (2001).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, respiratory organs, kidneys, adrenal)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Inhalation studies in rats and mice provide evidence of reduced locomotor activity/respiratory rate, pneumonia-like changes and kidney/adrenal congestion (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Inhalation studies in rats provide evidence of edema, congestion and necrosis in the brain, fibrosis in the heart and tetraplegia (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data : Methyl Bromide). Evidence of testicular atrophy was also found. The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a gas according to the GHS definition.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.3mg/L of he fish (Guppy) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1, there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 15%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=1.19(PHYSPROP Database, 2005), it was classified into Category 1.
